Package core

Class Window

java.lang.Object
core.Window
public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
This class implements the window where the game engine instance should be run

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void clear()
    this function clears the window of all rendered objects, textures and color
    void destroy()
    this function releases all callbacks of the window, destroys the window and terminates glfw
    int getHeight()
    Getter, returns the height of the window object
    static Window getInstance​(int width, int height, java.lang.String title, boolean vSync)
    this function returns the instance of the window if it exists, if not creates a new instance and returns it
    int getWidth()
    Getter, returns the width of the window object
    long getWindow()
    Getter, returns the current window object
    void init()
    This function initializes glfw and the window class object, throws an exception if it failes to initialize glfw or fails to create a glfw window
    boolean isRunning()
    this function returns wherever the current window object is running
    boolean isVSync()
    this function returns wherever vSync is turned on for the current window
    void render()
    This function renders objects by swapping buffers of the current window object
    void setMode​(WindowState windowMode)
    This function handles switching between window modes, it recives the window state to be switched to.
    void update()
    This window handles updating the window based on input given.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Window getInstance​(int width, int height, java.lang.String title, boolean vSync)
      this function returns the instance of the window if it exists, if not creates a new instance and returns it
      Parameters:
      width - width in pixels of the window to be created if it does not already exist
      height - height in pixels of the window to be created if it does not already exist
      title - name of the window to be created if it does not already exist
      vSync - if the window should have vSync turned on or off
      Returns:
      returns the instance of the window

    • init

      public void init()
      This function initializes glfw and the window class object, throws an exception if it failes to initialize glfw or fails to create a glfw window

    • update

      public void update()
      This window handles updating the window based on input given. Keyboard: -f11: sets window to full screen if currently in windowed and to windowed if currently in full screen

    • render

      public void render()
      This function renders objects by swapping buffers of the current window object

    • clear

      public void clear()
      this function clears the window of all rendered objects, textures and color

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      this function releases all callbacks of the window, destroys the window and terminates glfw

    • setMode

      public void setMode​(WindowState windowMode)
      This function handles switching between window modes, it recives the window state to be switched to. Window States: -FULLSCREEN: sets the window to full screen -WINDOWED: sets the window to windowed mode based on its height and width -BORDERLESS: sets the window to a maximized window without borders -HIDDEN: hides the window -SHOWN: shows the window
      Parameters:
      windowMode - the window mode to which the window must be switched

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      this function returns wherever the current window object is running
      Returns:
      true if window running, false if window no longer running and should close

    • isVSync

      public boolean isVSync()
      this function returns wherever vSync is turned on for the current window
      Returns:
      true if vSync is turned off, false otherwise

    • getWindow

      public long getWindow()
      Getter, returns the current window object
      Returns:
      the current window object

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Getter, returns the width of the window object
      Returns:
      the width

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Getter, returns the height of the window object
      Returns:
      the height
